export.blockjson.name: Block JSON
export.blockjson.title: Export Block JSON
export.blockjson.corner: Corner of block is at (0, 0) (click to change)
export.blockjson.centre: Center of block is at (0, 0) (click to change)
export.blockjson.relative: Block model is relative to wood block (click to change)
export.blockjson.absolute: Block model is relative to y = 0 (click to change)
tabula.export.headInfo.name: Head Info JSON
tabula.export.headInfo.forClass.tooltip: The full name and package of the entity that this is for
tabula.export.headInfo.modelFieldName.to:
The name of the field which has the head ModelRenderer.

More complicated classes may require hand edits or customClasses, bear in mind
tabula.export.headInfo.isBoss.tooltip: Is this entity normally considered a boss? EG: Ender Dragon, Wither
tabula.export.headInfo.affectedByInvisib: Disable to always render the Googly Eyes/Hat
tabula.export.headInfo.noFaceInfo.toolti: This disables all eye positioning info and makes Googly Eyes think there's no support
tabula.export.headInfo.eyeOffset.tooltip: The offset of the middle of the face from the head rotation point
tabula.export.headInfo.irisColour.toolti: The color of the Googly Eye "casing". The white bits.
tabula.export.headInfo.pupilColour.toolt: The color of the Googly Eye "bouncy part". The black bits.
tabula.export.headInfo.halfInterpupillar: Normally mobs have 2 eyes. This defines half of the space between them.
tabula.export.headInfo.eyeScale.tooltip: Big numbers = big eyes. Small numbers = small eyes.
tabula.export.headInfo.sideEyed.tooltip: Eyes are on the side of head. EG: Horses
tabula.export.headInfo.topEyed.tooltip: Eyes are on the top of head. EG: Hoglins
tabula.export.headInfo.eyeCount.tooltip: Number of eyes. Tabula render always presumes we have 2.
tabula.export.headInfo.doesEyeGlow.toolt: Do the eyes glow in the dark
tabula.export.headInfo.noTopInfo.tooltip: This disables all head top info and makes Hats think there is no support
tabula.export.headInfo.headTopCenter.too: The offset to the middle of the top of the head from the head rotation point.
tabula.export.headInfo.headScale.tooltip: Scale of Head (compared to a Player head)
tabula.export.headInfo.headCount.tooltip: Number of heads (EG: Wither). Tabula render always presumes we have one head. Having more than 1 will require a custom class.
tabula.export.headInfo.hatTiltPitch.tool: Hat Tilt from Head Top Center - Pitch
tabula.export.headInfo.hatTiltYaw.toolti: Hat Tilt from Head Top Center - Pitch
tabula.export.headInfo.headArmorOffset.t: How much more head top offset to give if wearing head gear
tabula.export.headInfo.headArmorScale.to: How much bigger should the hat be if wearing head gear
tabula.export.headInfo.customClassWarnin:
The Head Info you just loaded has custom class Head Info defined.

We've taken what we can into a generic Head Info.

If you need the info the custom class provides, you may have to re-add by hand.
tabula.export.headInfo.preview.tooltip:
Attempts to render a preview on the Head part that you have selected.

Try rotating the model a little bit to ensure it's accurate.
system.cannotRemoveHost: %s is host and cannot be removed as an editor.
system.hosting: You are hosting this Tabula session.
system.cannotReachHost: %s (host) is unavailable. They might have crashed or disconnected. Consider saving the models for them before exiting.
system.projectAlreadyOpen: That project appears to already be open.

config.tabula.cat.others.desc: Other configs that don't really fit. You probably don't want to touch these.

config.tabula.prop.disableAutosaves.name: Disable Autosaves
config.tabula.prop.favTheme.desc: Favorite Colour Theme for Tabula's Interface
config.tabula.prop.renderRotationPoint.d: Should the rotation point of selected model parts be rendered
Should the block in the workspace be rendered
config.tabula.prop.renderWorkspaceGrid.d: Should the grid in the workspace be rendered
config.tabula.prop.renderGrid.desc: Should the grid in the workspace be rendered
config.tabula.prop.renderModelControls.d: Should the controls on the model be rendered
config.tabula.prop.swapPositionOffset.de: Swap the position and offset of the model when changing either value?
config.tabula.prop.allowEveryoneToEdit.d: Allow anyone who connects to your Tabula session to edit the model
config.tabula.prop.editors.desc: People allowed to edit models in your multiplayer Tabula session.\nSeparate usernames by with a comma and a space (", " - no quotes)
config.tabula.prop.animateImports.desc: Try to animate the possibly imported models to fix their rotations?
config.tabula.prop.tooltipTime.desc: Time (in ticks) for tooltip to appear.
config.tabula.prop.forceGuiScale.desc: Force a GUI scale when entering the Tabula screen. Follows MC's GUI Scale, -1 disables, 0 is auto
config.tabula.prop.guiMaxDecimals.desc: Max decimals in number input boxes
config.tabula.prop.workspaceGridSize.des: How big should the workspace grid be?
config.tabula.prop.ignoreOldTabulaWarnin: If you open old Tabula files (pre 1.15), it pops up a warning. This disables that.
config.tabula.prop.disableAutosaves.desc: Disable the Autosave system Tabula has (I don't know why you'd do that though)
config.tabula.prop.maximumUndoStates.des: Maximum Undo States. More Undo states = More Memory Use
